  </div>

## Description

Odoo is a suite of open source business apps that include CRM, eCommerce, accounting, inventory, project management, etc.
This component allows you to query and manage records in an Odoo database.

### Developer Note: Odoo Models

An Odoo database tracks hundreds of types of records.
A default installation of Odoo includes more than 800 unique record types (more if you install additional apps).

Each type of record is called a **model**, and models have human-readable names and model names.
For example, contacts in Odoo are called `Contacts`, and their model name is `res.partner`.
To list all contacts in an Odoo installation, use the [List Records](#list-records) action and provide it a model of `res.partner`.

A **model** has **fields**.
`Contacts` for example has hundreds of fields related to a person: `name`, `email`, `country_code`, `zip`, etc.

For your convenience, two utility actions are included in this component.

- [List Models](#list-models) will list all models in an Odoo installation, including their ID, name and model name.
- [List Model Fields](#list-model-fields) will list all of the fields of a given model.

You can use these two utility actions to help you when you [Create](#create-record) or [Update](#update-record) records.
Identify the **name** of the fields you would like to set for a given model.
Then, create an object, either in a [code step](/docs/composer/builder/builder-components/code.mdx) or another action and pass the results of that step in as a reference.

## Connections

### Odoo Connection

Customers can use Odoo's cloud service to access an Odoo database, or they can run Odoo on their own servers.
Either way, Odoo uses basic auth to connect to an Odoo database.

- For **Base URL**, you can enter the URL you visit when you log in to Odoo (something like `https://example-company.odoo.com`).
- You can likely ignore **Server Port**, unless your customer uses a non-traditional port for accessing their Odoo installation.
- The **Database Name** can be found by clicking the user icon on the top-right within Odoo, and then selecting **My Databases**.
- **Username** is the email address the user uses to log in.
  We recommend they create a system account for integrations (i.e. not a specific user's account).
- **Password or API Key** can either be the password your customer uses to log in to Odoo, or they can generate an API key.
  To generate an API key, your customer will need to go into settings, enable developer mode, and then from their user preferences they can generate an API key.
  See [https://www.odoo.com/documentation/14.0/developer/api/external_api.html#api-keys](https://www.odoo.com/documentation/14.0/developer/api/external_api.html#api-keys).

<ComponentInputsTable
  inputs={[
    {
      required: true,
      example: "https://yourdomain.odoo.com",
      comments: "Enter the URL you visit when you log in to Odoo",
      key: "baseUrl",
      type: "string",
      default: "",
      label: "Odoo Base URL",
    },
    {
      required: true,
      example: "odoo_db",
      comments:
        "Click the user icon on the top-right within Odoo and then select 'My Databases'",
      key: "db",
      type: "string",
      default: "",
      label: "Odoo Database Name",
    },
    {
      required: true,
      key: "password",
      type: "password",
      default: "",
      label: "Password or API Key",
    },
    {
      required: false,
      example: "443",
      comments: "Leave blank to use default HTTP (80) or HTTPS (443)",
      key: "port",
      type: "string",
      default: "",
      label: "Server Port",
    },
    {
      required: true,
      example: "john.doe@example.com",
      key: "username",
      type: "string",
      default: "",
      label: "Username",
    },
  ]}
/>

## Actions

<div id="createrecord" />

### Create Record

Create a new record of a given type | <small><b>key: createRecord</b></small>

<ComponentInputsTable
  inputs={[
    {
      required: true,
      key: "connection",
      type: "connection",
      label: "Connection",
    },
    {
      comments:
        "A unique identifier mapping this record to an ID in an external system",
      required: false,
      example: "abc-123",
      key: "externalId",
      type: "string",
      default: "",
      label: "External ID",
    },
    {
      comments:
        "The type of record you would like to query for. Use the 'List Models' action for a list of available models.",
      required: true,
      example: "res.partner",
      key: "model",
      type: "string",
      default: "",
      label: "Model",
    },
    {
      language: "json",
      required: true,
      key: "parameters",
      type: "code",
      default:
        '{\n  "name": "John Doe",\n  "email": "doe@example.com",\n  "country_code": "US",\n  "city": "New York",\n  "zip": "10001"\n}',
      label: "Parameters",
    },
  ]}
/>

#### Output Example Payload

```
{
  "data": 25
}
```

<hr className="componentActionSeparator" />

    {
      comments:

      key: "id",
      type: "string",
      default: "",
      label: "Record ID",
    },
    {
      comments:
        "The type of record you would like to query for. Use the 'List Models' action for a list of available models.",
      required: true,
      example: "res.partner",
      key: "model",
      type: "string",
      default: "",
      label: "Model",
    },
  ]}
/>

    },
  ]}
/>

#### Output Example Payload

```
{
  "data": {
    "id": 12,
    "website_url": "/partners/john-doe-12",
    "email": "bob@example.com",
    "name": "John Doe",
    "display_name": "John Doe",
    "lang": "en_US"
  }
}
```

#### Output Example Payload

```
{
  "data": {
    "is_seo_optimized": {
      "type": "boolean",
      "change_default": false,
      "company_dependent": false,
      "depends": [],
      "manual": false,
      "readonly": true,
      "required": false,
      "searchable": false,
      "sortable": false,
      "store": false,
      "string": "SEO optimized",
      "name": "is_seo_optimized"
    },
    "website_meta_title": {
      "type": "char",
      "change_default": false,
      "company_dependent": false,
      "depends": [],
      "manual": false,
      "readonly": false,
      "required": false,
      "searchable": true,
      "sortable": true,
      "store": true,
      "string": "Website meta title",
      "translate": true,
      "trim": true,
      "name": "website_meta_title"
    }
  }
}
```

<div id="listmodels" />

### List Models

Fetch a list of models installed in the customer's Odoo database | <small><b>key: listModels</b></small>

<ComponentInputsTable
  inputs={[
    {
      required: true,
      key: "connection",
      type: "connection",
      label: "Connection",
    },
    {
      required: false,
      comments: "Search for models whose contain this search term",
      example: "res.partner",
      key: "modelSearch",
      type: "string",
      default: "",
      label: "Model Search",
    },
    {
      required: false,
      comments: "Search for models whose names contain this search term",
      example: "Partner",
      key: "nameSearch",
      type: "string",
      default: "",
      label: "Name Search",
    },
  ]}
/>

#### Output Example Payload

```
{
  "data": [
    {
      "id": 87,
      "name": "Bank Accounts",
      "model": "res.partner.bank",
      "state": "base",
      "modules": "account, base, l10n_us",
      "display_name": "Bank Accounts"
    },
    {
      "id": 85,
      "name": "Industry",
      "model": "res.partner.industry",
      "state": "base",
      "modules": "base",
      "display_name": "Industry"
    }
  ]
}
```

<div id="listrecords" />

### List Records

Fetch a list of records of a given type | <small><b>key: listRecords</b></small>

<ComponentInputsTable
  inputs={[
    {
      required: true,
      key: "connection",
      type: "connection",
      label: "Connection",
    },
    {
      comments:
        "Fetch only this many records at a time. See https://www.odoo.com/documentation/15.0/developer/api/external_api.html#pagination",
      example: "10",
      required: false,
      key: "limit",
      type: "string",
      default: "",
      label: "Pagination Limit",
    },
    {
      comments:
        "The type of record you would like to query for. Use the 'List Models' action for a list of available models.",
      required: true,
      example: "res.partner",
      key: "model",
      type: "string",
      default: "",
      label: "Model",
    },
    {
      comments:
        "Fetch records offset by this value. See https://www.odoo.com/documentation/15.0/developer/api/external_api.html#pagination",
      example: "20",
      required: false,
      key: "offset",
      type: "string",
      default: "",
      label: "Pagination Offset",
    },
  ]}
/>

If you expect Odoo will return lots of records, you can leverage [pagination](/docs/composer/builder/building-integrations.mdx#looping-over-a-paginated-api) to process a small set of records at a time.
See Odoo's docs on [pagination](https://www.odoo.com/documentation/15.0/developer/api/external_api.html#pagination).

#### Output Example Payload

```
{
  "data": [
    {
      "id": 12,
      "website_url": "/partners/john-doe-12",
      "email": "bob@example.com",
      "name": "John Doe",
      "display_name": "John Doe",
      "lang": "en_US"
    }
  ]
}
```

  inputs={[
    {
      required: true,
      key: "connection",
      type: "connection",
      label: "Connection",
    },
    {
      required: true,
      comments: "The action to execute in Odoo",
      example: "check_access_rights",
      key: "method",
      type: "string",
      default: "",
      label: "Method",
    },
    {
      comments:
        "The type of record you would like to query for. Use the 'List Models' action for a list of available models.",
      required: true,
      example: "res.partner",
      key: "model",
      type: "string",
      default: "",
      label: "Model",
    },
    {
      language: "json",
      required: true,
      key: "parameters",
      type: "code",
      default: '[["read"]]',
      label: "Parameters",
    },
  ]}

### Set External ID

Add an external ID to a record that does not have one | <small><b>key: setExternalId</b></small>

<ComponentInputsTable
  inputs={[
    {
      required: true,
      key: "connection",
      type: "connection",
      label: "Connection",
    },
    {
      comments:
        "A unique identifier mapping this record to an ID in an external system",
      required: true,
      example: "abc-123",
      key: "externalId",
      type: "string",
      default: "",
      label: "External ID",
    },
    {
      comments:
        "The ID of the record you want. Odoo uses numbers for record IDs.",
      example: "25",
      required: true,
      key: "id",
      type: "string",
      default: "",
      label: "Record ID",
    },
    {
      comments:
        "The type of record you would like to query for. Use the 'List Models' action for a list of available models.",
      required: true,
      example: "res.partner",
      key: "model",
      type: "string",
      default: "",
      label: "Model",
    },
  ]}
/>

{

}

      example: "res.partner",

    },
    {
      language: "json",
      required: true,
